proportion.translate: доля, часть, пропорция, пропорциональный, соразмерять, распределять
examples: Weight increases in proportion to height.
The sea which covers so large a proportion of the earth's surface.
Her head is ridiculously big in proportion to her body.
The proportion of women to men at my college was about five women to one man.
Let's keep a sense of proportion, and not rush to any hasty conclusions.
The proportion of the plucks to the passes is very sad.
Builders must learn about scale and proportion.
A dry martini has a large proportion of gin.
The test will give a proportion of false negatives.
The rewards you get in this job are in direct proportion to the effort you put in.
Women comprise a high proportion of part-time workers.
You can protest by all means, but keep a sense of proportion.
The amount of damages awarded are proportioned to the degree of injury caused.
Weight increases in direct proportion to mass.
Her feet are small in proportion to her height.
His ears were drawn out of proportion with his head.
A large proportion of occupiers now own their homes.
The whole issue has been blown out of all proportion.
What's the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
Spices had a high value in proportion to their weight.
Reduce the drawing so that all the elements stay in proportion.
Women make up only a small proportion of the prison population.
The proportion of women graduates has increased in recent years.
The decision affects a significant proportion of the population.
An inordinate proportion of the book is given over to quotations.
Every parent is asked to contribute a proportion of the total cost.
The size of the window seems out of proportion with the height of the wall.
The fear of violent crime has now risen out of all proportion to the actual risk.
Although the majority of offenders are men, a small proportion — about 5 percent — are women.
Clearly, the amount of money people save increases in inverse proportion to the amount they spend.
